Kāli Sutta：The Buddha，while staying at the Nigrodhārāma，visits his kinswoman Kāligodhā ofKapilavatthu，and tells her of the four qualities to be found in the sotāpanna -

unwavering loyalty to the Buddha， the Dhamma and the Sangha， freedom from all taint of stinginess， delight in self-surrender and in the dispensing of charitable gifts．Kāligodhā states that she possesses all these qualities．S．v．396．
